body_html:
@skye we should be giving better rror messages here. i believe the update_op is created inside a while loop context; but we're allowing it to be added as a control dependency on an op outside the context.

@sguada i remember we had a variant of batch_normalization that didn't require update op collections. do you recall how?
body_text:
@skye we should be giving better rror messages here.  i believe the update_op is created inside a while loop context; but we're allowing it to be added as a control dependency on an op outside the context.
@sguada i remember we had a variant of batch_normalization that didn't require update op collections.  do you recall how?
body:
@skye we should be giving better rror messages here.  i believe the update_op is created inside a while loop context; but we're allowing it to be added as a control dependency on an op outside the context.

@sguada i remember we had a variant of batch_normalization that didn't require update op collections.  do you recall how?
